Design and usability is really nice. In general everything also works quick. Just starting to play a song or playlist takes a couple of seconds until loads. Anything between 5 and 15 seconds for me on my linux device. If that could be fixed it would be 5 stars easily

description:
Some people apparently dont get how to use this app. Just folllow the steps needed to connect your spotify account.

No ads, downloadable music, shuffle function,...
Its great
I have no idea what signing up fora Spotify Developers account involves. No warning that this is required. Should be flagged up in the spec.
summary: Requires creation of Spotify Developers Account

description:
This app is as promised. A very lightweight and clear spotify alternative. It doesn't have any restrictions of a free account and integrates very well with an existing account! It does need you to sign in using a strange method where by you take some cookies using inspect element on your browser to sign in but after following the built in guide, it works perfectly. 

I mentioned in the summary that it needs a little polish. Here's what I have found.
- Hovering over the buttons for each track in a playlist bring up a context text that reads "widget" no matter which of the four you hover over.
- I can't really tell if a song I clicked download on has actually been downloaded. The button reacts to a click but there is no indication that the song is currently downloaded. (It does actually download if you check the destination directory)
- There is no shuffle option
- The download folder doesn't seem to be configurable
- The playerlist download button is grayed out
- the volume slider isn't consistant

All in all it's a cool product if you don't have a premium account. It's very lightweight too which is a big plus. It's just really needs some refinement.
summary: Works very well! Needs a little polish but is very nice!

description: The recent freezing after one song on Nobara has put me off this app
Nice and usefull, also lyrics from Geniuse - really nice. But I need devices functionality.
i use steamdeck desktop, try to play it and it just crashed after a few minutes.

The app's UI is easy to navigate, it's familiar to anyone who's used Spotify before, and I found it easy to log in. It does require a few technical steps to start using it, but the app guides you through the process very effectively. It's amazing that this works so well!

Absolutely love it. I have it on phone as well, was super pleased to see that it was available on Linux. As of the current update from July 1st 2023 the app just pulls up a black screen and won't load. Maybe it's just me? Don't let that keep from trying it out though. Simple and effective, great work.
Really sweet, TheUI looks better than the official spotify app IMO. All the functionality the original brings is there.

App have basic features but is still way behind the web app and thus cannot replace it yet.
Logo and name need to be replaced.
but, the app isn't the "best" at all, it doesn't start next track, is kinda laggy, and so on
I'm using the latest fedora and have 16GB of ram. If they manage to fix it it will be a great alternative. As the current state of it I wouldn't recommend.
summary: Great app, but it has a memory leak

description: works fine can easily skip within track (using keyboard) , doesn't hang on next song, so far great
La he instalado, su apariencia, personalización y funcionalidad me gusta mucho

I've been using this app for a little while now. It just works and does what I've come to expect. Sure, the navigation is not as smooth as in the official Spotify app, but come on. Keep up the good work!

The idea cool, the implementation good, but if i understood correctly, it "scrapping out" your spotify likings, but actual music comes from youtube with few ad-remove extensions, right?
 Very few songs are totally different from what i actually saved, that's not critical, but abit annoys. I hope there some way to implement "choose source input from Youtube or Spotify". 
Also i encountered 1 bug: somewhy when i play songs, i heard "power-cracking", the energy noise, no matter volume or song playing, occasional sound glitches, just like aux not fully inserted (Fedora 38 flatpak).
summary: Great idea, good implementation, but there's a room for improve

description: Says what it does exactly What I was Looking for.
Dev claims "Anonymous/guest login" and "No telemetry, diagnostics or user data collection" but you can't do anything other than "browse" without logging in...
Frequently I must force close the app start over due to unresponsiveness, which get on your nerves pretty quickly. I encourage the dev's to keep at it.
Don't waste your time
this app is nothing short of a miracle especialy with all that spotify has done recently

This is ridiculously useful, great bit of software.

I initially used an older version on Debian 11 that was buggy, but as of v3.3 it's been perfectly stable for me.
Sometimes I could clearly hear short stuttering or crackling, which isn't the case with official Spotify app.
Pretty Good app.
Worked right from the jump, and exactly what I was looking for. Beautiful UI, y'all putting on a clinic to do Linux apps right!

I genuinely don't understand how this works. Copied my Spotify cookie over (which I don't feel too good about, I'd much prefer an API key...), and 30 seconds later it showed my songs,. Tried clicking play on a dozen different songs, but nothing. So I uninstalled it.
At which point it started playing...
So I installed it again, and yeah, now it's "working".

Now, I can play any song in the current queue. Neat. But I still cannot play anything else. It just doesn't respond.
And after 20 minutes, the interface just froze.

It also has pretty inconsistent UI/UX design. 
Looks great, generally, but it doesn't handle as well.

- The buttons in the context menu seem grayed out.
- The matching "accent" is a very nice touch, but even the background changes, which is more annoying than anything.
- The buttons are not placed logically, and often do not have proper feedback.
- The tooltips show up immediately which is just clutter for a music player. Please delay it. Also, the clock button just says"Show Menu" which tells me nothing.
- The lyrics should switch to plain if synced isn't available.
- The Mini player needs an opacity slider. It's unusable now.

But most of all, I just don't understand what this does.
Does it get and manage my playlist data from Spotify, but play the actual songs through Youtube music or something? Because that'd be unusable for me, as many of my songs are only on Spotify or only on YT Music.

But if it doesn't do that, then how come it isn't synced with all my other devices? Is it just using no account to stream and block the ads? Because I don't want that. I want Spotify to know what I'm listening to. It's a useless service if it doesn't know my taste.
greattt app recommend
I love it! I can downloand it and have transparent miniplayer

The title says it all. As others have pointed out the design is quite nice. Kind of sus it takes the cookie, but allows it to load all personalized stuff. Okay. But when I click on anything, playback does not work. And from how I understood it, it doesn't even use Spotify for playback but YouTube. Why?
summary: Looks nice, but does not work

description: I really liked the idea behind spotube, but the execution and frequent freezes both on linux and on android are quite annoying for me to keep using it.

Performance not entirely showing what framework is capable off... But is better than electron app. UI is more simplified than usefulness and verboseness. Album, Artist, and a lot other functions will be broken but kinda works.
summary: Lot of features are broken but impressive

description: After updating I can't launch the app.
summary: Can't launch it after update to the 3.5.0
